keyword: how many calories are in sliced cheese
title: How Many Calories Are in Sliced Cheese?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in sliced cheese per standard slice, including full nutrition breakdown, protein, fat, carbs, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories Are in Sliced Cheese?
assumptions: Standard 1 oz (28 g) slice of cheddar cheese; pasteurized, processed or natural.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cheese type, brand, fat content, and slice thickness. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One standard slice of cheddar cheese contains about 113 kcal and 7 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Swiss cheese slice instead of cheddar

faqs.q: How many calories are in one slice of cheddar cheese?
faqs.a: Approximately 113 kcal for a standard 28 g slice.

faqs.q: What is the fat content in sliced cheese?
faqs.a: About 9.3 g total fat per slice, including 5.3 g saturated fat.
Very low—only 0.4 g carbs per slice, with 0 g fiber and sugars.

faqs.q: How much protein in a slice of cheese?
faqs.a: Around 7 g protein per standard slice.

faqs.q: Why does sodium vary in sliced cheese?
faqs.a: Added salt and preservatives; ranges from 150–200 mg per slice depending on brand.
